item.title: Women headline holiday movies but still face 'celluloid ceiling' - CNN
item.description:
Women headline holiday movies but still face 'celluloid ceiling'  CNN

Women play starring roles in a flurry of films that will carry through the holiday season. But when it comes to the status of women in Hollywood, as Thursday's Golden Globe nominations suggested, it often feels like there's a step back -- or at least a pause -- for every step forward. A shortage of quality roles for women -- especially older women -- has been a longstanding concern in the movie business, prompting many actresses to migrate to television. Still, this year's roster of year-end films -- many chasing awards consideration -- has yielded what feels like an unusually strong crop o...

item.title: Kidman’s name called again - The Australian
item.description:
Kidman’s name called again  The Australian

Nicole Kidman received her 13th nod and the political satire Vice was a surprise frontrunner at yesterday’s announcement of nominees for the Golden Globes. Kidman, a four-time winner, was nominated for best actress (drama) for her role in Karyn Kusama’s Destroyer as a cop revisiting trauma from an old undercover case. Another Australian actress, Yvonne Strahovski, received a best supporting actress nod for her role in the TV drama The Handmaid’s Tale. It is her first Globes ­nomination. Joel Edgerton’s Boy Erased received two nominations: best actor (drama) for Lucas Hedges and best origina...

item.title: Nicole Kidman Did Not Tell Keith Urban About Her Fondness For Tom Cruise - International Business Times
item.description:
Nicole Kidman Did Not Tell Keith Urban About Her Fondness For Tom Cruise  International Business Times

Latest rumors claim Nicole Kidman has confessed her love for Tom Cruise in front of husband Keith Urban. Gossip Cop debunked the reports after speaking to Urban’s representative. The actress said in an interview with New York Magazine that shegot “protection” at a young age because she was married to Cruise, a “powerful star.” Star magazine reported this statement did not go down too well with Urban. The magazine quoted an insider saying, “He feels it’s extremely disrespectful for Nicole to be speaking about Tom so fondly. But she’s always loved her partners so fiercely, she’s probably told...

item.title: For absolutely no reason, here are 29 women directors who made outstanding films in 2018 - Fast Company
item.description:
For absolutely no reason, here are 29 women directors who made outstanding films in 2018  Fast Company

Earlier this year, Lady Bird filmmaker Greta Gerwig became the fifth woman in history ever to be nominated for a Best Director Oscar. Ever! That’s one hand!” she told USA Today, summing up the sadly small club she’d just entered. Although the argument for better female representation behind the camera has been raging for years, the glaring rareness of Gerwig’s achievement became a flashpoint. Of all the great movies ever made by women, how could only a single handful ever have been deemed worthy of nomination? (And with only one winner!) Headlines seized on the unfortunate notoriety of Gerw...

item.title: Nicole Kidman and more react to Golden Globe nominations - CNN
item.description:
Nicole Kidman and more react to Golden Globe nominations  CNN

Hollywood woke up to Golden Globe nominations news on Thursday morning. The lucky nominees are celebrating and here's a sample of their reactions: Nicole Kidman, Best Performance by an Actress in a Motion Picture, Drama for "Destroyer" "I am so grateful to be nominated for such an untraditional female character. Erin Bell is complicated, raw and dangerous, and it was a privilege to portray her. I share this with Karyn Kusama as well as all of the cast and crew. It was truly a passion project for all of us. A huge thank you to The Hollywood Foreign Press." Emily Blunt, Best Actress in a Moti...

item.title: Nicole Kidman: ‘To hear women being believed makes me cry’ - The Guardian
item.description:
Nicole Kidman: ‘To hear women being believed makes me cry’  The Guardian

Nicole Kidman began this year, her 51st, accepting a Golden Globe award as best actress for her unforgettable role in the TV series Big Little Lies. In her speech she thanked her mother – a nurse who wished she’d been a doctor – for never setting limits on what her daughters could be, declaring: “My achievements are her achievements.” She also paid tribute to her friend Reese Witherspoon, with whom she had produced the series, and the actors they had starred with in it, Laura Dern, Shailene Woodley, Zöe Kravitz. “Wow,” she said, “the power of women!” It seemed like a good moment to be makin...

item.title: Nicole Kidman: Hearing women being believed in #MeToo era ‘makes me cry’ - The Independent
item.description:
Nicole Kidman: Hearing women being believed in #MeToo era ‘makes me cry’  The Independent

Nicole Kidman has opened up about the impact the #MeToo movement has had in Hollywood, saying women who have been through traumatic experiences being believed “makes me cry”. Earlier this year, Kidman revealed how her first marriage to Tom Cruise provided her with “protection” from sexual abuse in Hollywood. The Big Little Lies actor and producer told The Observer the development of the show coincided with the growth of the #MeToo movement, making her portrayal of a domestic abuse survivor much more poignant. - Read more Hollywood after #MeToo: ‘There is fear, tension and no end in sight’ T...

item.title: Keith Urban Did Not Have Alcoholism Relapse In 2018 - International Business Times
item.description:
Keith Urban Did Not Have Alcoholism Relapse In 2018  International Business Times

A tabloid recently tried to cash-in on country singer Keith Urban’s struggle with alcoholism in the past by claiming that his wife, Nicole Kidman, sent him to rehab when he had a relapse of his addiction earlier in 2018. The story, however, had no semblance of truth in it. The false report, which was published by the unreliable outlet New Idea, claimed Urban “came close to a breakdown” and just like Kidman had successfully managed to stage an intervention and get him out of his destructive addiction 12 years ago, she did the same for him this time around too. “Keith’s been through a rough f...

item.title: Nicole Kidman, Keith Urban Not Following Rules To Save Marriage - International Business Times
item.description:
Nicole Kidman, Keith Urban Not Following Rules To Save Marriage  International Business Times

Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban did not save their supposedly troubled marriage through couple therapy nor are they following relationship rules, despite rumors. Gossip Cop debunked these reports after speaking to a source close to both of them. In Touch quoted an alleged insider saying “Keith and Nicole have been through hell and back over the last couple of years and it’s no secret they’ve come close to splitting.” The source then added the two were about to end their marriage earlier this year, however, “after a lot of therapy and imposing a new list of relationship rules, they’ve come out...

item.title: Nicole Kidman reveals she almost quit one of her most famous film roles - The Independent
item.description:
Nicole Kidman reveals she almost quit one of her most famous film roles  The Independent

Nicole Kidman has opened up about her career during a BAFTA lecture in London. The Australian actor was in the UK's capital for the Life in Pictures event which saw her discuss her career as well as gender imbalance in the industry and the impact of HBO series Big Little Lies which she stars in alongside Reese Witherspoon. During the talk, Kidman revealed she almost dropped out of playing one of her most high-profile roles: Virginia Woolf in Stephen Daldry drama The Hours (2002). - Read more Who are the early front runners for the Oscars? “It was interesting because I got very, very scared ...

item.title: Leah Remini: Tom Cruise Personally Punished Fellow Scientologists - The Daily Beast
item.description:
Leah Remini: Tom Cruise Personally Punished Fellow Scientologists  The Daily Beast

Photo Illustration by The Daily Beast In the acclaimed documentary Going Clear: Scientology and the Prison of Belief, a number of accusations were made against Tom Cruise, the Church of Scientology’s most famous member. According to Marty Rathbun, a high-ranking Scientologist and sometime enforcer, “I was to facilitate the breakup with Nicole Kidman.” Rathbun alleged in the film that the Church took a number of measures to convince Cruise to cut ties with his then-wife, a non-believer, including wiretapping her phone, “auditing” Cruise day and night, and “re-educating” their adopted childre...

item.title: Nicole Kidman interview: ‘I was born to be an actor’ - Financial Times
item.description:
Nicole Kidman interview: ‘I was born to be an actor’  Financial Times

I always tell young actors it’s a gift to be given any role. Even if it is a small role, do your best, because you never know where it’s going to take you, what you are going to get from it.” Even after 35 years in movies, Nicole Kidman has no desire to rest on her laurels. This autumn alone she can be seen in three vastly different films: the tense family drama Boy Erased, the low-budget crime thriller Destroyer and the DC Comics superhero picture Aquaman. And, at 51, she is not taking this diversity for granted. “I have been through many times when I didn’t have the opportunity to play ro...

item.title: Hugh Grant joins Nicole Kidman in new HBO series from Big Little Lies team - The Telegraph
item.description:
Hugh Grant joins Nicole Kidman in new HBO series from Big Little Lies team  The Telegraph

Hugh Grant will make his US television debut in HBO’s miniseries The Undoing, starring opposite Academy awarding winning actress Nicole Kidman. The six episode limited series will be directed by Susanne Bier and written and executive produced by David E. Kelley, who adapted Liane Moriarty’s novel Big Little Lies as a miniseries; that series also starred Kidman, in 2017 and won multiple Emmys. The Undoing focuses on Grace Sachs (Kidman), a successful therapist living the only life she ever wanted for herself in New York City with her husband (Grant) and young son. However, overnight Grace is...

item.title: The Undoing: Hugh Grant to star alongside Nicole Kidman in mysterious new HBO series - The Independent
item.description:
The Undoing: Hugh Grant to star alongside Nicole Kidman in mysterious new HBO series  The Independent

Hugh Grant is set to star with Nicole Kidman in an HBO series. The actor has been cast to play in The Undoing, an upcoming six-episode show based on Jean Hanff Korelitz's novel You Should Have Known, Deadline reported. Kidman will appear as Grace Sachs, a New York City therapist with a successful career and blessed personal life – at least when her story begins. - Read more Why Richard Curtis wanted to cast Alan Rickman in Four Weddings Grace's life is thrown into turmoil after a violent death occurs and her husband Jonathan – who will be played by Grant – goes missing. This causes Grace to...

item.title: Would Have Loved To Have More Kids: Nicole Kidman - International Business Times
item.description:
Would Have Loved To Have More Kids: Nicole Kidman  International Business Times

In an interview with Who magazine, actress Nicole Kidman said there was still a part of her that would love to have had more children. The 51-year-old Australian actress is already the mother of four — she adopted Isabella, 25, and Connor, 23, with ex-husband Tom Cruise and has Sunday Rose, 10, and Faith Margaret, 7, from her marriage with Keith Urban. In an interview published in the latest issue of Who magazine, the actress was asked if she would consider having a fifth child. Photo: Getty Images/Rodin Eckenroth “I would love to have had more,” she said. “Nothing is ever totally out of th...

item.title: Nicole Kidman Not Planning To Team Up With Katie Holmes For Joint Project - International Business Times
item.description:
Nicole Kidman Not Planning To Team Up With Katie Holmes For Joint Project  International Business Times

An unreliable tabloid has recently come out with a story that claimed actor Tom Cruise’s ex-wives – Nicole Kidman and Katie Holmes – were planning to appear together in a “Hollywood production.” However, the rumor was debunked by Gossip Cop. The outlet which attempted to spread the baseless rumor was Grazia, a United Kingdom publication, which claimed to have exclusively learnt from its insiders, based in Los Angeles, that Cruise’s former wives were preparing to team up for an upcoming project. “Katie and Nicole have exchanged messages via their agents. But out of respect to Tom it’s been k...

item.title: Nicole Kidman, Keith Urban Not Looking To Have Third Child - International Business Times
item.description:
Nicole Kidman, Keith Urban Not Looking To Have Third Child  International Business Times

Claims that Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban wanted a baby boy, and they were looking into options were proven false Tuesday. Gossip Cop debunked the claim which came out in New Idea with the title “Nicole’s Baby Joy: It’s A Boy!” The website said the couple, parents to two young girls Sunday Rose and Faith Margaret, isn’t planning to have a third child at the moment. The magazine claimed Kidman is pregnant, saying the actress, who apparently “opened up about wanting more children,” was “tenderly touching her stomach” as she posed for photos at the Los Angeles premiere of her new movie “Boy Er...

item.title: Liane Moriarty on diversity, #MeToo and Nine Perfect Strangers: 'It's a tricky time to be a writer' - The Guardian
item.description:
Liane Moriarty on diversity, #MeToo and Nine Perfect Strangers: 'It's a tricky time to be a writer'  The Guardian

Liane Moriarty is having fun. The central character of her new book, Nine Perfect Strangers, is Frances: a menopausal romance novelist who describes being accosted by a publisher at a writers’ festival in her heyday. He told Frances, “his voice hot and hasty in her ear”, how it was his “destiny to publish her”, how he and only he “could and would take her to the next level”. That’s a little Moriarty joke because “the fact is that Frances as a romance novelist would not be invited to writers’ festivals, just as I was not invited to writers’ festivals for many years”. So, sweet revenge? “Yes,...

item.title: Troye Sivan Brings On The Heartbreak With 'Boy Erased' Song 'Revelation' - HuffPost
item.description:
Troye Sivan Brings On The Heartbreak With 'Boy Erased' Song 'Revelation'  HuffPost

Troye Sivan plays a “gay conversion” camp attendee in “Boy Erased,” but he didn’t have to abandon his musical sensibilities entirely for the role. The pop singer, whose hits include “My My My!” and “Bloom,” teamed up with Sigur Rós frontman Jónsi for “Revelation,” a new song included on the “Boy Erased” soundtrack. On Thursday, he released a moody lyric video for the plaintive ballad featuring footage from the film, which stars Lucas Hedges and Nicole Kidman. “It’s a revelation, there’s no hell in what I’ve found/No kingdom shout,” Sivan sings in the video, which can be viewed above. “How t...

item.title: 'Boy Erased' leaves mark with tale of gay-conversion therapy - CNN
item.description:
'Boy Erased' leaves mark with tale of gay-conversion therapy  CNN

There's plenty of big-name talent in "Boy Erased," including the Australian triumvirate of Nicole Kidman, Russell Crowe and director-writer-co-star Joel Edgerton. The film, however -- based on Garrard Conley's memoir about his experience with gay-conversion therapy -- largely belongs to Lucas Hedges, in a movie that doesn't oversell its message in exposing the damage such intolerance can inflict. Hedges plays Jared (yes, the name has been slightly changed), the son of an Arkansas minister (Crowe) who, after enrolling in college, must come to grips with the fact that he's gay. Exposed throug...

item.title: Nicole Kidman Dishes On 'Big Little Lies' Season 2 With Ellen DeGeneres - HuffPost
item.description:
Nicole Kidman Dishes On 'Big Little Lies' Season 2 With Ellen DeGeneres  HuffPost

Nicole Kidman is sworn to secrecy as far as the next season of “Big Little Lies” is concerned, but she let a few details slip in her Tuesday appearance on “The Ellen DeGeneres Show.” The Oscar winner told the host Season 2 of the Emmy- and Golden Globe-winning HBO series will be a family affair, with daughters Faith Margaret, 7, and Sunday Rose, 10, appearing as extras. Still, Kidman said her kids are more impressed by her forthcoming connection to the superhero world ― she plays Queen Atlanna in “Aquaman,” due out in December ― than by their time on the “Big Little Lies” set. “That’s the o...

item.title: Troye Sivan on starring in gay conversion therapy movie ‘Boy Erased’: “It definitely struck a chord” - NME Live
item.description:
Troye Sivan on starring in gay conversion therapy movie ‘Boy Erased’: “It definitely struck a chord”  NME Live

The film also stars Nicole Kidman The pop star plays Gary in the film Troye Sivan has opened up about his role in new movie Boy Erased, saying it “definitely struck a chord” with him. Boy Erased also stars the likes of Nicole Kidman and Russell Crowe. Sivan plays a supporting role as a man the central character Jared (Lucas Hedges) meets at a gay conversion therapy program he is sent to by his Baptist parents (Kidman and Crowe). It’s based on Garrard Conley’s 2016 memoir of the same name and was written and directed by Joel Edgerton. Speaking of filming the movie, Sivan said it was an emoti...

item.title: Joel Edgerton wanted 'Boy Erased' to be irrelevant. It's far from it - CNN
item.description:
Joel Edgerton wanted 'Boy Erased' to be irrelevant. It's far from it  CNN

As director Joel Edgerton sees it, "Boy Erased" is a story about fear, but he didn't always see it that way. In the film, based on the memoir by Garrard Conley, a young man (Lucas Hedges) is sent to gay conversion therapy by his religious parents after revealing to them that he is gay. "One of the most startling aspects of the book was -- and, I guess, in my naive approach leading into the book -- I figured decisions to send a child to conversion therapy [are] born out of the hatefulness and that these institutions, the infrastructure is erected on this sense of hatefulness," Edgerton told ...

item.title: Profile: Liane Moriarty’s Hollywood Angst: It’s Complicated - The New York Times
item.description:
Profile: Liane Moriarty’s Hollywood Angst: It’s Complicated  The New York Times

SYDNEY, Australia — Liane Moriarty was still groggy, lying in her young son’s bed one morning, staring up at a poster for some Hollywood blockbuster, when her agent and publisher called with important news: “Big Little Lies” would debut at No. 1 on the New York Times best-seller list. “It was a very domestic Liane Moriarty setting,” she joked, sitting on the north side of Sydney Harbor near where she lives. “I think my little girl was in the bed with me because there had been some bed hopping, and there were just these excited voices on the line from New York.” Four years later, no other mo...

item.title: Aquaman TV spot sees Jason Momoa's hero step up to the plate - The Independent
item.description:
Aquaman TV spot sees Jason Momoa's hero step up to the plate  The Independent

A tv spot for Aquaman has revealed new footage from the upcoming DC superhero movie. Jason Momoa reprises his role from Justice League, following on from the events of that film and seeing the character, named Arthur Curry, battle with those on land who threaten Atlantis, and those in Atlantis who want to battle the land-dwellers. - Read more Aquaman trailer debuts at San Diego Comic-Con - watch This is the first solo film for the character, with a solo film also planned for Justice League's The Flash (Ezra Miller). Other DC films set for release are Shazam!, Wonder Woman 1984, and Birds of...

item.title: Lucas Hedges And Troye Sivan Connect In Emotional 'Boy Erased' Clip - HuffPost
item.description:
Lucas Hedges And Troye Sivan Connect In Emotional 'Boy Erased' Clip  HuffPost

Lucas Hedges and Troye Sivan share an intimate moment in this exclusive clip from the new film “Boy Erased,” based on author Garrard Conley’s real-life experience undergoing so-called gay conversion therapy. Watch the clip from “Boy Erased” above, exclusively on HuffPost. Based on Conley’s 2016 memoir, “Boy Erased” follows Jared Eamons (played by Hedges), a fundamentalist Christian teen who is outed by a college classmate. After Jared’s parents (Nicole Kidman and Russell Crowe) learn that their son is gay, they enroll him in a reparative, or “ex-gay,” therapy camp where participants are fo...

item.title: Nicole Kidman Looks Unrecognizable In Gritty 'Destroyer' Trailer - HuffPost
item.description:
Nicole Kidman Looks Unrecognizable In Gritty 'Destroyer' Trailer  HuffPost

Nicole Kidman knows a little something about transforming for a role. But this time around, she’s ditched the facial prosthetics (if you haven’t seen “The Hours,” literally, what are you doing?) for a severe make-under in her new movie “The Destroyer.” The first trailer for the crime thriller helmed by “Jennifer’s Body” director Karyn Kusama arrived on Wednesday, and it shows the Academy Award-winner as you’ve never seen her before. Kidman stars as LAPD detective Erin Bell, whose undercover mission with a California gang that includes “Avengers” star Sebastian Stan goes horribly wrong. Year...

item.title: Nicole Kidman says being married to Tom Cruise protected her from sexual harassment in Hollywood - The Telegraph
item.description:
Nicole Kidman says being married to Tom Cruise protected her from sexual harassment in Hollywood  The Telegraph

Nicole Kidman has said being married to Tom Cruise gave her "protection" from sexual harassment in Hollywood. The Australian actress married Cruise in 1990, when she was 22, after they starred together in Days Of Thunder. In an essay for New York Magazine Kidman, now 51, said the marriage, which lasted a decade, meant she avoided becoming a victim of harassment. She wrote: "I got married very young, but it definitely wasn't power for me - it was protection. I married for love, but being married to an extremely powerful man kept me from being sexually harassed." Hollywood has been engulfed b...

item.title: Nicole Kidman says marriage to Tom Cruise protected her from sexual harassment - The Independent
item.description:
Nicole Kidman says marriage to Tom Cruise protected her from sexual harassment  The Independent

Nicole Kidman has claimed that being married to Tom Cruise provided her with “protection” from sexual abuse in Hollywood. Kidman and Cruise were married on Christmas Eve in 1990 after meeting on the set of action film Days of Thunder in 1989. The pair were married for over 10 years and adopted two children: Isabella Jane, who was born in 1992, and Connor Antony, who was born in 1995. - Read more Nicole Kidman gives powerful Emmys speech on domestic violence Kidman has previously been disinclined to discuss her relationship with Cruise since he filed for divorce from her in 2001. However, sh...

item.title: Nicole Kidman Says Tom Cruise Marriage Protected Her From Sexual Harassment - HuffPost
item.description:
Nicole Kidman Says Tom Cruise Marriage Protected Her From Sexual Harassment  HuffPost

Nicole Kidman says her high-profile marriage to Tom Cruise insulated her against the rampant sexual abuse in Hollywood. Speaking with New York Magazine for its new issue about women and power, the “Big Little Lies” star opened up about how early on in her career she was spared from all-too common instances of sexual harassment due to Cruise’s star power. “Being married to Tom Cruise at 22 is something I’m always reluctant to talk about, because I’m married now to the man who is my great love [Keith Urban], and it almost feels disrespectful,” Kidman wrote in an essay for the outlet. “That sa...

item.title: Nicole Kidman: Marriage to Tom Cruise protected me - CNN
item.description:
Nicole Kidman: Marriage to Tom Cruise protected me  CNN

Nicole Kidman married Tom Cruise for love, but ended up getting shielded from sexual harassment as well. That's what the actress contends in an as told-by-her essay published in New York magazine. The "Big Little Lies" star met Cruise when they both were cast for the film "Days of Thunder" and married in 1990. The pair adopted a son and a daughter before ending their marriage after 11 years. Kidman is now married to country singer Keith Urban, with whom she shares two daughters. The actress typically shies away from talking about her ex. "Being married to Tom Cruise at 22 is something I'm a...

item.title: The Best and Worst of the Week’s Trailers: Actress Showcases - The New York Times
item.description:
The Best and Worst of the Week’s Trailers: Actress Showcases  The New York Times

Oscar season is afoot, and the best actress race looks to be very competitive. This week’s new trailers bring us several hopefuls, led by Nicole Kidman, Saoirse Ronan and Margot Robbie (unless she’s entered as a supporting actress), who star in the most promising of the new promotional clips. ‘Destroyer’ (Due Dec. 25) Ms. Kidman could also be up for best supporting actress for her performance as the conflicted mother of a gay son in “Boy Erased,” but it’s her bracing turn as a Los Angeles cop haunted by an undercover operation gone bad in the director Karyn Kusama’s drama that might put her...

item.title: Nicole Kidman Not Pregnant With Keith Urban’s ‘Miracle’ Baby - International Business Times
item.description:
Nicole Kidman Not Pregnant With Keith Urban’s ‘Miracle’ Baby  International Business Times

According to the latest rumor, actress Nicole Kidman is pregnant with a third child at the age of 51 with husband Keith Urban, which was due next year. However, Gossip Cop reported there was no truth to the rumor. The false narrative was spun by In Touch magazine, which claimed the couple, despite already having two daughters, was pining for a third child that would save their allegedly failing marriage. The tabloid quotes an anonymous insider who said that the husband and wife were in couple’s therapy due to the troubles they were facing in their relationship and during one of the sessions...

item.title: Listen to Troye Sivan and Sigur Ros’ Jónsi’s calming new collaboration ‘Revelation’ - NME Live
item.description:
Listen to Troye Sivan and Sigur Ros’ Jónsi’s calming new collaboration ‘Revelation’  NME Live

It's taken from the soundtrack to the forthcoming film 'Boy Erased' Troye Sivan / Jónsi Troye Sivan and Sigur Ros‘ Jónsi have shared their first ever collaboration, ‘Revelation’ – check it out below. The two artists have linked up for a spot on the soundtrack to the upcoming film Boy Erased, which Sivan has a supporting part in. Jónsi has also recorded another song for the soundtrack, which is set for a digital release on October 26 and physically on November 2 (the same day as Boy Erased‘s theatrical release). Ahead of that full release, ‘Revelation’ has been shared today (October 19) – li...

item.title: Nicole Kidman duets with Keith Urban in honor of International Day of the Girl - CNN
item.description:
Nicole Kidman duets with Keith Urban in honor of International Day of the Girl  CNN

Keith Urban enlisted the help of three very important women in his life to help him mark International Day of the Girl. Urban and wife Nicole Kidman performed a duet of the country star's song "Female" in honor of the special day, a performance that was subsequently filmed by their daughters, Sunday and Faith, and posted by the actress to Instagram. RELATED: Michelle Obama: Educate every girl Kidman is featured in the background vocals on the studio version of the song, but has never performed it with her husband in public. "Of all songs to have her sing on, it was the right one," Urban tol...

item.title: Truth About Keith Urban's Anger Over Russell Crowe Complimenting Nicole Kidman - International Business Times
item.description:
Truth About Keith Urban's Anger Over Russell Crowe Complimenting Nicole Kidman  International Business Times

According to a latest rumor, singer Keith Urban’s possessiveness toward his wife Nicole Kidman was making him jealous of the comments by actor Russell Crowe regarding his better half. However, the baseless rumor was debunked by Gossip Cop. The premise of the false story was concocted by Woman’s Day magazine, which insisted Crowe’s recent comments about Kidman during an interview about their upcoming movie together, “Boy Erased,” was not sitting well with her husband. The tabloid reported comments by Crowe, such as, “I waited a long time to be married to Nicole,” – which was meant as a joke ...

item.title: Revealed: How 56-year-old Tom Cruise stays looking so young (possibly) - The Telegraph
item.description:
Revealed: How 56-year-old Tom Cruise stays looking so young (possibly)  The Telegraph

In any sane world, Tom Cruise Mapother IV would not be looking this good. The actor, producer, triple divorcee and father of three shouldlook a bit like Tom Cruise – albeit a slightly melted version, like how John Travolta now looks like John Travolta dredged from a canal. He should have a paunch, walk with at least one limp, and be greying. In short (very short, 5ft 7ins), by now he should look less like a Hollywood action hero and more like Paul Hollywood, bread hero. Because that's the nature of middle age. At the time of writing, Cruise is 56 years, three months and one week old: two ye...

item.title: Hotel Mumbai stars’ favourite SA places - The Advertiser
item.description:
Hotel Mumbai stars’ favourite SA places  The Advertiser

In the case of Hammer, star of The Social Network and Call Me By Your Name, he spent his 30th birthday at Seppeltsfield’s Hentley Farm with his wife who flew out to join him. “We drank an amazing amount of Barossa Valley and McLaren Vale wine,” said Hammer, ahead of his arrival on Wednesday for the Australian premiere of Hotel Mumbai which launches the 2018 Adelaide Film Festival. “We did Adelaide right, it was an exceptional experience.” Hammer and Patel, who co-starred with Nicole Kidman in the Australian film Lion, will be joined by actor Tilda Cobham-Hervey, who is from Adelaide, and th...

item.title: Big Little Lies author Liane Moriarty pokes fun at wellness 'religion' - ABC News
item.description:
Big Little Lies author Liane Moriarty pokes fun at wellness 'religion'  ABC News

She's sold more than 14 million books worldwide. She's had three books on the New York Times bestseller list. She's stood on stage with Nicole Kidman at the Emmys. But Australian author Liane Moriarty says she still can't help reading online articles that promise to transform her life. "If I see a headline that says, 'make this one small change in your life and you'll be transformed forever', it is impossible not to click on that article to find out what that one small change is," she says. The author is fascinated by how obsessively people — including herself — pursue health, wellness, and...

item.title: Leah Remini Explains Rift In Katie Holmes Friendship - International Business Times
item.description:
Leah Remini Explains Rift In Katie Holmes Friendship  International Business Times

Katie Holmes shocked many when she filed for divorce from Tom Cruise in June 2012. Even though the stars managed to finalize the process in less than two months, actress Leah Remini is now claiming the terms that brought the marriage to an end came with restrictions. When Holmes and Cruise legally dissolved their union, little was known about the terms of their divorce settlement other than the “Dawson’s Creek” alum received primary physical custody of their daughter Suri Cruise. In a sneak peek of Remini’s interview with LaPalme magazine, via Us Weekly, the “Kevin Can Wait” actress reflect...

item.title: Farewell, my lovely: film’s female detectives get nasty - Financial Times
item.description:
Farewell, my lovely: film’s female detectives get nasty  Financial Times

“I can’t be talking about it and not doing it,” Nicole Kidman told the press last year, on the subject of working with female film directors. Otherwise, she believes, nothing will change. Fine words, and the Aussie superstar has lived up to them. But feminists who welcomed her promises might not be the only ones surprised — shocked, exhilarated, confused? — by her new movie with director Karyn Kusama. Destroyer, which has had early outings at Telluride and Toronto film festivals in the past few weeks, and comes to London Film Festival in October, takes an old trope, gives it the now almost ...
